channel.title: NPR Programs: Morning Edition
channel.description: Morning Edition takes listeners around the country and the world with multi-faceted stories and commentaries every weekday. Hosts Steve Inskeep, Leila Fadel, Michel Martin and A Martínez bring you the latest breaking news and features to prepare you for the day.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Minnesota Gov. Walz says Trump agreed to 'consider' reducing number of ICE agents
item.description: Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz says President Trump has agreed to "consider" reducing the number of federal agents in the state, following the killing of Alex Pretti.
item.content:encoded: Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz says President Trump has agreed to "consider" reducing the number of federal agents in the state, following the killing of Alex Pretti.
item.dc:creator: Matt Sepic

item.title: Republican state representative on why he called for ICE surge in Minnesota to end
item.description: NPR's Steve Inskeep speaks with Republican Minnesota State Rep. Nolan West, who represents part of Minneapolis, about the reservations he's expressed on the federal show of force in the state.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Steve Inskeep speaks with Republican Minnesota State Rep. Nolan West, who represents part of Minneapolis, about the reservations he's expressed on the federal show of force in the state.
item.dc:creator: Steve Inskeep

item.title: What does TikTok's new ownership mean for users in the U.S.?
item.description: Since news about TikTok finalizing a deal to spin-off its U.S. operations became public, users have questioned what U.S. ownership of the app means for them.
item.content:encoded: Since news about TikTok finalizing a deal to spin-off its U.S. operations became public, users have questioned what U.S. ownership of the app means for them.
item.dc:creator: Hosts

item.title: Meta, TikTok and YouTube are on trial over whether their apps hurt children
item.description: A trial kicking off in a Los Angeles courtroom marks the first time a jury will hear claims that social media companies knowingly hook young users and cause harm.
item.content:encoded:
A trial kicking off in a Los Angeles courtroom marks the first time a jury will hear claims that social media companies knowingly hook young users and cause harm.

(Image credit: Spencer Platt)
item.dc:creator: Shannon Bond

item.title: Trump heads to Iowa hoping to refocus attention from shootings to the economy
item.description: More Republicans are calling for an investigation after a second U.S. citizen was shot by a federal agent in Minneapolis.
item.content:encoded:
More Republicans are calling for an investigation after a second U.S. citizen was shot by a federal agent in Minneapolis.

(Image credit: Alex Brandon)
item.dc:creator: Franco Ordoñez

item.title: Morning news brief
item.description: Trump will "consider" reducing number of ICE agents in Minnesota, governor says, Trump hopes to turn attention back to the economy in Iowa Tuesday, social media apps on trial over effects on children.
item.content:encoded: Trump will "consider" reducing number of ICE agents in Minnesota, governor says, Trump hopes to turn attention back to the economy in Iowa Tuesday, social media apps on trial over effects on children.
item.dc:creator: Michel Martin

item.title: 'There's a lot of truth and pain in comedy': Alia Shawkat on war satire 'Atropia'
item.description: The film "Atropia" is a dark comedy set at a U.S. military facility in California designed to simulate battle conditions in Iraq. NPR's Leila Fadel speaks with actor Alia Shawkat.
item.content:encoded: The film "Atropia" is a dark comedy set at a U.S. military facility in California designed to simulate battle conditions in Iraq. NPR's Leila Fadel speaks with actor Alia Shawkat.
item.dc:creator: Leila Fadel

item.title: Conservative news outlets start to break from government's narrative on ICE incidents
item.description: Conservative news outlets and commentators have been, until now, resolutely defending the use of lethal force by ICE and Border Patrol agents in Minneapolis and elsewhere. That's starting to change.
item.content:encoded: Conservative news outlets and commentators have been, until now, resolutely defending the use of lethal force by ICE and Border Patrol agents in Minneapolis and elsewhere. That's starting to change.
item.dc:creator: David Folkenflik

item.title: For Olympic veterans, perspective and experience are their secret weapon
item.description: Some Olympic athletes are heading to Italy next month for their third, fourth or even fifth shot at gold. They are working "smarter not harder" and trading on their instincts honed over time.
item.content:encoded: Some Olympic athletes are heading to Italy next month for their third, fourth or even fifth shot at gold. They are working "smarter not harder" and trading on their instincts honed over time.
item.dc:creator: Pien Huang

item.title: Despite free testing, some schools have been slow to check for lead in their water
item.description: There's federal money for local schools to test their water for lead, which can be dangerous for kids. Many school systems opt not to test their faucets, even if it's free.
item.content:encoded: There's federal money for local schools to test their water for lead, which can be dangerous for kids. Many school systems opt not to test their faucets, even if it's free.
item.dc:creator: Molly Samuel
